meanings.definition: A person or thing that annihilates.
meanings.sent1: The superhero was known as the ultimate annihilator of evil forces.
meanings.sent2: The exterminator was the annihilator of all pests in the house.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner, the pet hair annihilator, worked tirelessly to keep the house clean.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the player acted as the annihilator, destroying all obstacles in their path.
meanings.sent5: The storm was an unstoppable annihilator, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: A mathematical operator that combines with a given function to produce the zero function.
meanings.sent1: The zero function annihilator in math class made solving equations easier.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician used the annihilator to simplify complex functions.
meanings.sent3: The math professor jokingly referred to the annihilator as the 'function terminator'.
meanings.sent4: The annihilator function in calculus erased all traces of the original equation.
meanings.sent5: The student finally understood the concept of the annihilator after practicing with various functions.
